metadata.name: Unjoin: On the Raucous Edge of Stability
metadata.description:
In mid-2022, Sarin's artwork continues to evolve from semi-
representational still imagery to abstract art, now expanding into
movement and sound dimensions. For the latter, she
commissioned a piece from Toronto-based composer Michael
Galkin, who suggested the title "Unjoin."As in opposite to “if you
can’t beat them join them”. Her works becomes a manifesto of
the contrarian rebellious artist who gradually becomes
ambivalent about being called an AI Artist as since recently AI art
started to largely mean a prompt-based fantasy/surrealism. An
urgent manifesto to bring attention to the AI art as solidly
grounded in the neural networks and their underlying aesthetics.

The animation was generated by iterating through a chain of AI
models using Sarin’s landscape and black-and-white drawings.
She uses deep blues and blacks, sharp and curvy patterns and
shapes to play over the industrial/grunge drone of the drums;
creating a sense of urgency and restlessness through pulsating
visual and audio patterns. Visual rhythms of grid and pattern
grasp at the neural entanglement but cooled down by the
pulsating beat and the color palette.

In this artwork, 'the edge of stability' symbolizes a balancing act
of creative exploration at the risk of losing the general audience,
much like the balance between overfitting and underfitting in
machine learning models - anything to escape being stuck in
pleasing common minima. 'Unjoin' represents a moment of
separation from convention, urging viewers to experience the
raucous edge of stability.
